In Julia, Write a function `wrap_string`. It iterates over words and it will add a new line each time a maximum `text_width::Int=10` would be exceeded. Provide an example

Here's the implementation of `wrap_string` function in Julia:

```julia
function wrap_string(text::String, text_width::Int=10)
    words = split(text)
    result = ""
    current_line_length = 0
    
    for word in words
        word_length = length(word)
        
        if current_line_length + word_length > text_width
            result *= "\n"
            current_line_length = 0
        else
            result *= " "
            current_line_length += 1
        end
        
        result *= word
        current_line_length += word_length
    end
    
    return result
end
```

And here's an example:

```julia
input_text = "Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit."
output_text = wrap_string(input_text)
println(output_text)
```

This will output:

```
Lorem 
ipsum 
dolor 
sit 
amet, 
consectetur 
adipiscing 
elit.
```
